name: Overseer Assault
description:
Overseer Assault is a turn-based local multiplayer tactics game, where a team of human soldiers with big guns faces off against a team of supercomputers that defends themselves using tower-defense mechanics. It works, I promise.

First built in 2006 as part of a dev competition (we weren't calling them "jams" back then), Overseer Assault is the first complete game I ever made. Built in Game Maker 6, it lacks sound, proper graphics, and has some glaring faults, but is otherwise a fairly complete experience and a reasonably fun time around one computer. It has a tutorial, level editor, and animated sprites. Fun for all the family.
